main event: On July 17, 1957, pilot Thomas H. Hanley of an RB-47 observed an unidentified flying object while conducting a reconnaissance mission over Forbes AFB, Kansas.
interesting points: The object was reported to be approximately 50-75 feet in diameter and shiny metallic in appearance,The sighting lasted for about 3 minutes during which time the object performed several maneuvers, including rapid acceleration,The sighting was corroborated by radar operators at Forbes AFB, who detected no identifiable targets in the area at the time,The object was noted to be moving at an estimated speed of 600-700 miles per hour,The incident prompted further investigation by Air Force intelligence and was classified as 'Unidentified' in Project Blue Book files.
witness description: pilot and crew member of the RB-47 aircraft
